Discussions.Discussion_Name: Open Source Mobile Network Technologies, April 17, 2024, TU Berlin Campus

Messages.Author: Elena-Ramona Modroiu
Messages.Content: Dear Students, our Chair Next Generation Networks (AV), led by Prof. Thomas Magedanz, organizes on April 17, 2024 the Open Source Mobile Network Technologies Conference at TU Berlin. It is a one day event where you can meet some of the key people behind the popular open source 4G/5G-related projects and toolkits (such as: srsRAN, Free5GC, OpenAirInterface, LENA-5G, Osmocom/pySIM, Kamailio) as well as learn about experiences on using open source based 4G/5G deployments. Prof. Thomas Magedanz will provide insights of the academic research directions.  The schedule and further details are available at:     - https://www.open6gnet.org/osmnt2024-conference/  Registration for the event is free, but the number of seats are limited. Students interested in participating at the event are kindly invited to register by filling the registration form:     - https://www.open6gnet.org/osmnt2024-registration/  Looking forward to meeting you!  Best regards, Ramona Modroiu

Messages.Author: Ivaylo Daskalov
Messages.Content: Dear 5G/6G Software Networks Team,  On the Example Exam there is a place to fill out your major with MSc: Computer Science. Does this mean that this course is only for master students or it can be taken by bachelors too?

Messages.Author: Daniela Laura Floroiu
Messages.Content: Dear students, The examination of "5G/6G Software Networks" module could be taken into account by all degree programs, B.Sc. and M.Sc. Best regards Daniela Floroiu

Messages.Author: Maksim Tretiakov
Messages.Content: Is there a strict grading scale for the exam or it will be flexible more or less?  Thanks!

Messages.Author: Dilowan Gögebakan
Messages.Content: Hello.  I got sick and would need to sign off from the exam. Is it possible to just register for the 2nd exam?  Best  Dilowan

Messages.Author: Daniela Laura Floroiu
Messages.Content: Hi, Yes, starting 18.07.  Best regards Daniela Floroiu

Messages.Author: Daniela Laura Floroiu
Messages.Content: Dear exchange students, Please send me an e-mail in order to prepare your "proof of academic achievement" for the module "5G / 6G Software Networks". Best regards Daniela Floroiu

Messages.Author: Mohamed Aziz Lazzem
Messages.Content: Hello ,  Should we prepare all topics for the exam or are some not included?  Thanks

Messages.Author: Daniela Laura Floroiu
Messages.Content: Hello, Yes, you should prepare all topics unless Dr. Corici has differently specified in the lecture. Best regards Daniela

Discussions.Discussion_Name: Important: Lecture on 03.07.2024 will start at 8:30 am

Messages.Author: Daniela Laura Floroiu
Messages.Content: Dear students, Due to the participation of Mr. Corici at Berlin 6G conference, the lecture ”5G/6G Software Networks” on Wednesday, 03.07.2027 will start at 8:30. Best regards Daniela Floroiu

Messages.Author: Simay Kocabey
Messages.Content: Hello,  Just wanted to ask: Is the 2nd exam  just for the people who didn't pass the first exam or can we choose between two dates.  Thank you for your help,  Best Regards, Simay Kocabey

Messages.Author: Daniela Laura Floroiu
Messages.Content: Hi,  According to the regulations, we will offer two examinations terms this semester: first attempt and retake date. You can register directly for the second term. In case of fail you will be able to repeat the exam just in SoSe2025.  Best regards, Daniela Floroiu

Messages.Author: Daniela Laura Floroiu
Messages.Content: Dear students, Please find below the following new materials: Lecture 05 – 5G Architecture II - 1 (this is an update) Lecture 06 - Network Management recording – the video of the lecture. Lecture 08 – Campus networks Lecture 09 – Beyond 5G RAN and NTN Lecture 10 – 6G Best regards Daniela Floroiu

Messages.Author: Fabian Stroschke
Messages.Content: Hello,   will there be some kind of mock-up exam, learning material or a list of relevant topics for the exam?  Best regards Fabian

Messages.Author: Daniela Laura Floroiu
Messages.Content: Hello everybody, You will get some examples before the examination. Best regards Daniela Floroiu

Discussions.Discussion_Name: Workshop Series on Open Source Mobile Network Technologies

Messages.Author: Elena-Ramona Modroiu
Messages.Content: Dear Students,  Our department Architekturen der Vermittlungsknoten, led by Prof. Magedanz, organizes the workshop series “Open Source Mobile Network Technologies” for the students that would like to get hands-on experience with the latest 5G technologies. You are warmly invited to participate and deepen your knowledge.  Event type: Workshop / Meet&Greet (no credit points; limited seats; seats assignment on a first come first served policy)  Coordinator: Elena-Ramona Modroiu  Location: HFT-TA 340  Schedule:     Fr 24.05.2024 10:30-12:00     Fr 31.05.2024 10:30-12:00     Fr 07.06.2024 10:30-12:00     Fr 14.06.2024 10:30-12:00  Registration: email to elena-ramona.modroiu@tu-berlin.de  Content: Experiment with the latest open source mobile network technologies guided by our researchers. Students bring own notebook with Linux (preferable Ubuntu). Step by step instructions will be provided for each lab.  Lab-1: Software Defined Radio to implement a 5G antenna. Install srsRAN project and configure it to connect to a 5G core network installed and configured in the cloud. Connect a 5G capable mobile phone to the newly deployed private 5G network and test the connection to Internet.  Lab-2: 5G Core Network. Install an open source 5G core network on own notebook and configure it. High view on the main components.  Lab-3: Simulated UE and RAN (instead of over the air setup), for easier testing of more complex scenarios. Install an open source project simulating the  mobile phone (UE) and the 5G antenna (RAN) and configure it to connect to a 5G core network.  Lab-4: Adding over-the-top Voice Services to an existing 5G private network  Being a Meet&Greet event, you have the opportunity to ask our researchers about their current work, while also trying by yourself the main open source technologies for mobile networks, solving step by step the tasks we proposed in each lab.  To register please send an email to elena-ramona.modroiu@tu-berlin.de with the subject "Registration for Workshop Series: Open Source Mobile Network Technologies".  Looking forward to meeting you!

Messages.Author: Dilowan Gögebakan
Messages.Content: Hello,  I am sorry but I am a little confused by the structure of this course.  Does it only consist of the lectures and an exam at the end? Will there be no other things to do than to attend the lectures and will we be just able to sign up for the exam at the end of the semester?  Best regards Dilowan

Messages.Author: Daniela Laura Floroiu
Messages.Content: Hello Dilowan,  Indeed, the form of this course is "Vorlesung" consisting of lectures and ending with the examination.  Best regards Daniela Floroiu
